definition: sailing a zigzag course, reverse (a direction, attitude, or course of action)
details:
noun
- sailing a zigzag course
- (nautical) the act of changing tack
= synonyms: tacking
- (nautical) a line (rope or chain) that regulates the angle at which a sail is set in relation to the wind
= synonyms: shroud, sheet, mainsheet, weather sheet
- gear for a horse
= synonyms: saddlery, stable gear
- a short nail with a sharp point and a large head
- the heading or position of a vessel relative to the trim of its sails
verb
- reverse (a direction, attitude, or course of action)
= synonyms: interchange
- fix to
= synonyms: hang on, append, tag on, tack on
- sew together loosely, with large stitches
= synonyms: baste
- fasten with tacks
= example: fasten with tacks
- create by putting components or members together
= synonyms: piece, set up, assemble, put together, tack together
- turn into the wind
= example: turn into the wind
= synonyms: wear round
